_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: The Federal Railroad Administration and American Association of Railroads

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
**Please Note: Blank/Empty Boxes are intended to be Blank. Esubmit portal doesn't allow to fill in sections with No or N/A.  

Executive Summary
 
Swan Ranch- The Granite Peak Group (Swan Ranch) is the region's largest industrial park located at the intersections of I-80, I-25, Burlington Northern Santa Fe (B.N.S.F.) railroad and Union Pacific Railroad (U.P.).  Development lots from one to 550 acres are provided with utility and rail infrastructure for industrial users.  The facility is located in Cheyenne, WY, where HollyFrontier Corporation (H.F.C.) also operates a refinery.  H.F.C. stores liquid petroleum gas (L.P.G.) and diesel tank cars at the site Swan Ranch facility.

The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (O.S.H.A.) standard, 29 C.F.R. Part 1910.119 Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals requires that employers develop and implement a P.S.M. and R.M.P. Program whenever quantities of the chemicals listed in Appendix A of the standard exceed the recommended thresholds or when the total amount of flammable liquids on site exceed 10,000 lbs.  O.S.H.A. defines flammable liquids as having a flash point of 100°F or less.

US Environmental Protection Agency (U.S.E.P.A.) regulation 40 C.F.R. 68 Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions sets forth the list of regulated substances and thresholds, the requirements for owners or operators of stationary sources concerning the prevention of accidental releases and the State accidental release prevention programs.  The list of substances, threshold quantities and accident prevention regulations promulgated under that part also do not limit in any way the U.S.E.P.A. general duty provisions under the Risk Management Planning requirements.

The flammable liquids (< 100°F) in the onsite processes, specifically the switching and storage of L.P.G. tank cars, exceeds the 10,000 lbs. P.S.M. and R.M.P. regulatory thresholds and therefore Swan Ranch- The Granite Peak Group management has develope

d the following combined program. The methanol tank was modeled using pure methyl formate; because, methanol is not listed in the RMP*Comp database and "Reference for Consequences Analysis".  Methyl formate was conservatory selected; because, it has the lowest molecular weight compared to other flammable liquids found in Table C-2 and has a lower flammability liquid limit than methanol.  

Swan Ranch is comprised of a number of separate business operations that this P.S.M. and R.M.P. Program Manual for L.P.G. and diesel railcar transport/storage is intended to cover.  Cheyenne Logistics Hub, L.L.C. (C.L.H.) is the owner of railroad track and land.  Swan Ranch Rail Road, a Division of Watco, is the short line operator.  Granite Peak Trans Loading, L.L.C. functions as the trans-loader of diesel.  To date, there have only been four rail cars of diesel trans-loaded and it is uncertain whether this operation will be continued.  Finally, Cheyenne Rail Hub, L.L.C. (C.R.H.) is responsible for track rental, rail car storage, and potential trans-loading.

The processes at the modern, approximately 7,200-acre facility are designed, operated and maintained in full compliance with recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices (RAGAEP); and applicable building and industry codes.  NFPA 30 Flammable and Combustible Liquids Code, 2018 was adhered to in the new construction design and building of the regulated processes.  NFPA 30 is part of the International Fire Code, which is widely recognized by state and local inspecting governments.

Process and risk safety management systems and procedures are in place to manage changes in process technology, facilities, operating procedures and maintenance procedures in order to provide for continued safe and reliable operations.

All employees at the Swan Ranch facility understand that they have the responsibility to protect the environment and to ensure the safety and security of their fellow workers.  Written policie

(34,500 gallons/ 241,500 pounds @ 7-lbs./gallon).  Typical loaded for transport volumes are approximately 30,000 gallons.  Both the methanol and diesel liquid tank cars have a sloped bottom and covered bottom outlet valve.

L.P.G. has a flash point of -156° F, which is <100° F the P.S.M. and R.M.P. applicability thresholds.  Methanol has a flash point of 52° F, which is also <100° F and under the P.S.M. threshold; however, methanol's boiling point is >100° F so there is no R.M.P. applicability.  The diesel tank cars are included in this program as a best management practice since diesel has a flash point of 126° F, which exceeds all of the 100° F P.S.M. and R.M.P. thresholds.

This information, in combination with written procedures and trained personnel, provides a basis for establishing P.S.M. and R.M.P. inspection and maintenance activities, as well as for evaluating proposed process.
